get.description:
Health check endpoint for container orchestration.
Returns status 200 if the service is running.

This endpoint retrieves the metadata from a list of VDP databases (separated by commas) and returns it in JSON and natural language format.
Optionally, if given access to a Denodo-supported vector store, it can also insert the metadata using the embeddings provider of your choice.

You can use the view_prefix_filter and view_suffix_filter parameters to filter the views that are inserted into the vector store
from the specified databases/tags.
For example, if you set view_prefix_filter to "vdp_", only views that start with "vdp_" will be inserted into the vector store.

To use incremental, please set incremental to True. On first call, it will return all views associated with the specified databases/tags
and activate tracking of changes. After that, you calling getMetadata with incremental set to True on the same set of databases/tags will only vectorize views
that have been modified since the last sync.

parameters.name: vdp_tag_names

schema.description: NOTE: When both databases and tags are specified, views from both sources are included (union), not their intersection. For example, if you have a database 'db1' and a tag with name 'tag1', the views of 'db1' and the views of 'tag1' will be included, minus duplicates.
schema.title: Vdp Tag Names

parameters.description: NOTE: When both databases and tags are specified, views from both sources are included (union), not their intersection. For example, if you have a database 'db1' and a tag with name 'tag1', the views of 'db1' and the views of 'tag1' will be included, minus duplicates.

parameters.name: views_per_request

schema.description: Number of views to ask for per request to the Denodo Platform. This is implemented to avoid handling too many views in a single request that might overload the server.
schema.title: Views Per Request

parameters.description: Number of views to ask for per request to the Denodo Platform. This is implemented to avoid handling too many views in a single request that might overload the server.

parameters.name: parallel

schema.description: If set to true, vectorization through the embeddings provider and insertion into the vector store will be done in parallel. Denodo Platform requests will remain sequential.
schema.title: Parallel

parameters.description: If set to true, vectorization through the embeddings provider and insertion into the vector store will be done in parallel. Denodo Platform requests will remain sequential.

delete.description:
Deletes views from the vector store based on database names or tag names.

If `delete_conflicting` is set to `False`, only views that satisfy all of the following conditions will be deleted:
- The associated database is included in the list of databases to delete, or it has not been previously synchronized (view was synchronized through a tag).
- All active tags are included in the list of tags to delete, or those tags have not been previously synchronized.

This behavior ensures that only views that unambiguously match the deletion criteria are removed, while preserving any entries that may be linked to other synchronized sources.

get.description:
This endpoint performs a similarity search on the vector database specified in the request.
The vector store MUST have been previously populated with the metadata of the views in the vector database
using getMetadata endpoint.

Gets the synchronized VDBs and tags with their last synchronization date.
This list is filtered to show only the resources that contain at least one view
the current user has permissions for.

Returns the current AI SDK LLM configuration, including base LLM,
thinking LLM settings, and the list of valid providers.
This information can be used to pre-fill settings in client applications.

This endpoint processes a natural language question and:

- Searches for relevant tables using vector search
- Determines whether the question should be answered using a SQL query or a metadata search
- Generates a VQL query using an LLM if the question should be answered using a SQL query
- Executes the VQL query and gets the data
- Streams back an answer to the question using the data and the VQL query

For now, this endpoint only streams back the answer and doesn't return the JSON response like answerQuestion does.

This endpoint will also automatically look for the the following values in the environment variables for convenience:

- EMBEDDINGS_PROVIDER
- EMBEDDINGS_MODEL
- VECTOR_STORE
- SQL_GENERATION_PROVIDER
- SQL_GENERATION_MODEL
- CHAT_PROVIDER
- CHAT_MODEL
- CUSTOM_INSTRUCTIONS
- VQL_EXECUTE_ROWS_LIMIT
- LLM_RESPONSE_ROWS_LIMIT

As you can see, you can specify a different provider for SQL generation and chat generation. This is because generating a correct SQL query
is a complex task that should be handled with a powerful LLM.

parameters.name: llm_max_tokens

schema.description: The maximum OUTPUT tokens for the general LLM. Not recommended to decrease this value.
schema.title: Llm Max Tokens

parameters.description: The maximum OUTPUT tokens for the general LLM. Not recommended to decrease this value.

parameters.name: vdp_database_names

schema.description: A comma-separated list of databases to reduce the scope of the question to. If empty, all databases in the vector DB the user has permissions to will be considered.
schema.title: Vdp Database Names

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of databases to reduce the scope of the question to. If empty, all databases in the vector DB the user has permissions to will be considered.

parameters.name: vdp_tag_names

schema.description: A comma-separated list of tags to reduce the scope of the question to. If empty, all tags in the vector DB the user has permissions to will be considered.
schema.title: Vdp Tag Names

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of tags to reduce the scope of the question to. If empty, all tags in the vector DB the user has permissions to will be considered.

parameters.name: allow_external_associations

schema.description: If False, views from associations will NOT be considered if they don't belong to the VDBs/Tags specified in vdp_database_names and vdp_tag_names. If no VDBs/Tags specified, all views from associations will be considered.
schema.title: Allow External Associations

parameters.description: If False, views from associations will NOT be considered if they don't belong to the VDBs/Tags specified in vdp_database_names and vdp_tag_names. If no VDBs/Tags specified, all views from associations will be considered.

parameters.name: use_views

schema.description: Please specify a view you want the LLM to take into consideration when answering the question. Expected format is views separated by commas: database.view_name, database.view_name2
schema.title: Use Views

parameters.description: Please specify a view you want the LLM to take into consideration when answering the question. Expected format is views separated by commas: database.view_name, database.view_name2

parameters.name: expand_set_views

schema.description: If set to true, the LLM will search for relevant views in the vector store. If set to false, the LLM will not search in the vector store and will only access those specified in use_views
schema.title: Expand Set Views

parameters.description: If set to true, the LLM will search for relevant views in the vector store. If set to false, the LLM will not search in the vector store and will only access those specified in use_views

parameters.name: vector_search_k

schema.description: Number of results to return from the similarity search in the vector store.
schema.title: Vector Search K

parameters.description: Number of results to return from the similarity search in the vector store.

parameters.name: vector_search_sample_data_k

schema.description: Number of similar sample data rows to return for the given question.
schema.title: Vector Search Sample Data K

parameters.description: Number of similar sample data rows to return for the given question.

parameters.name: vector_search_total_limit

schema.description: Maximum number of views to consider in total, including associations of the initial vector_search_k results.
schema.title: Vector Search Total Limit

parameters.description: Maximum number of views to consider in total, including associations of the initial vector_search_k results.

parameters.name: vector_search_column_description_char_limit

schema.description: Maximum characters of table or column descriptions used when filtering how many views to keep. Not applied during vector search or VQL generation (those use full descriptions). Refer to the docs for when this trimming is applied.
schema.title: Vector Search Column Description Char Limit

parameters.description: Maximum characters of table or column descriptions used when filtering how many views to keep. Not applied during vector search or VQL generation (those use full descriptions). Refer to the docs for when this trimming is applied.

parameters.name: check_ambiguity

schema.description: If false, skip ambiguity detection.
schema.title: Check Ambiguity

parameters.description: If false, skip ambiguity detection.

- Generates a VQL query using an LLM if the question should be answered using a SQL query

tags: Ask a Question - Streaming - Custom Vector Store
post.description:
The only difference between this endpoint and `streamAnswerQuestion` is that this endpoint
expects the result of the vector search to be passed in as a parameter.

To simply limit or force the LLM to use a specific set of views, please use answerQuestion.

This is useful for implementations with custom vector stores.

This endpoint will also automatically look for the the following values in the environment variables for convenience:

- EMBEDDINGS_PROVIDER
- EMBEDDINGS_MODEL
- VECTOR_STORE
- SQL_GENERATION_PROVIDER
- SQL_GENERATION_MODEL
- CHAT_PROVIDER
- CHAT_MODEL

As you can see, you can specify a different provider for SQL generation and chat generation. This is because generating a correct SQL query
is a complex task that should be handled with a powerful LLM.

get.description:
This endpoint processes a natural language question and tries to answer it using the metadata in Denodo.
It will do this by:

- Searching for the relevant tables' schema using vector search
- Generating an answer to the question using the metadata

This endpoint will also automatically look for the the following values in the environment variables for convenience:

- EMBEDDINGS_PROVIDER
- EMBEDDINGS_MODEL
- VECTOR_STORE
- LLM_PROVIDER
- LLM_MODEL
- LLM_TEMPERATURE
- LLM_MAX_TOKENS
- CUSTOM_INSTRUCTIONS

You can also override the LLM temperature and max_tokens via API parameters for fine-tuning the model behavior.

tags: Ask a Question - Custom Vector Store
post.description:
The only difference between this endpoint and `answerQuestion` is that this endpoint
expects the result of the vector search to be passed in as a parameter.

To simply limit or force the LLM to use a specific set of views, please use answerQuestion.

This is useful for implementations with custom vector stores.

Process a a complex analysis question using deepQuery. This endpoint returns the analysis answer along with metadata that can be used for report generation
in a separate endpoint call to generateDeepQueryReport.

Generate an HTML report from a DeepQuery analysis.

This endpoint takes the metadata returned from the deepQuery endpoint and generates
a comprehensive HTML report with visualizations and analysis details.

The metadata should contain all the necessary information from the analysis phase
including conversation history, tool calls, cohorts, and schema information.

base_llm.description: Configuration for the base LLM used for general tasks.

thinking_llm.description: Configuration for the thinking/reasoning LLM. Null if not configured.

deepquery_execution_model.title: Deepquery Execution Model
deepquery_execution_model.description: Which LLM is used for DeepQuery execution: 'thinking' or 'base'.

valid_providers.title: Valid Providers
valid_providers.description: List of supported LLM provider names.

temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.description: The temperature setting for the LLM.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum output tokens for the LLM.

syncedResources.title: Syncedresources
syncedResources.description: Dictionary of fully synced resources (databases/tags) with their last sync dates and view counts.

partialResources.title: Partialresources
partialResources.description: Dictionary of partially synced resources (databases/tags) that have some but not all views synced.

vector_search_total_limit.description: Maximum number of views to consider in total, including associations of the initial vector_search_k results.

vector_search_column_description_char_li.title: Vector Search Column Description Char Limit
vector_search_column_description_char_li.description: Maximum characters of table or column descriptions used when filtering how many views to keep. Not applied during vector search or VQL generation (those use full descriptions). Refer to the docs for when this trimming is applied.

llm_max_tokens.title: Llm Max Tokens
llm_max_tokens.description: The maximum OUTPUT tokens for the general LLM. Not recommended to decrease this value.

vdp_database_names.title: Vdp Database Names
vdp_database_names.description: A comma-separated list of databases to reduce the scope of the question to. If empty, all databases in the vector DB the user has permissions to will be considered.

vdp_tag_names.title: Vdp Tag Names
vdp_tag_names.description: A comma-separated list of tags to reduce the scope of the question to. If empty, all tags in the vector DB the user has permissions to will be considered.

allow_external_associations.title: Allow External Associations
allow_external_associations.description: If False, views from associations will NOT be considered if they don't belong to the VDBs/Tags specified in vdp_database_names and vdp_tag_names. If no VDBs/Tags specified, all views from associations will be considered.

use_views.title: Use Views
use_views.description: Please specify a view you want the LLM to take into consideration when answering the question. Expected format is views separated by commas: database.view_name, database.view_name2

expand_set_views.title: Expand Set Views
expand_set_views.description: If set to true, the LLM will search for relevant views in the vector store. If set to false, the LLM will not search in the vector store and will only access those specified in use_views

vector_search_k.title: Vector Search K
vector_search_k.description: Number of results to return from the similarity search in the vector store.

vector_search_sample_data_k.title: Vector Search Sample Data K
vector_search_sample_data_k.description: Number of similar sample data rows to return for the given question.

vector_search_total_limit.title: Vector Search Total Limit
vector_search_total_limit.description: Maximum number of views to consider in total, including associations of the initial vector_search_k results.
